enum-member.comment: PDCP Status Report will neither be sent by eNB nor sent by UE
enum-member.name: EStatusReport_NoStatusReport

enum-member.comment: PDCP Status Report will be prepared by source eNB and sent to UE by target eNB
enum-member.name: EStatusReport_eNbStatusReport

enum-member.comment: Target eNB must be able to handle PDCP Status Report received from UE
enum-member.name: EStatusReport_UeStatusReport

enum-member.comment: eNB must be able to handle PDCP Status Report received from the UE and to prepare and send PDCP Status Report
enum-member.name: EStatusReport_eNbUeStatusReport

enum-member.comment: Includes: Amount of forwarded data per bearer index 1..16 on transmitter side (PDCP SDU size, downlink forwarding, Inter eNB forwarding, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte), Amount of forwarded data per bearer index 1..16 on receiver side (PDCP SDU size, downlink forwarding, Inter eNB forwarding, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte), Amount of forwarded data per bearer index 1..16 on transmitter side (PDCP SDU size, uplink forwarding, Inter eNB forwarding, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte), Amount of forwarded data per bearer index 1..16 on receiver side (PDCP SDU size, uplink forwarding, Inter eNB forwarding, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte), Amount of discarded forwarding data per bearer index 1..16 on transmitter side (PDCP SDU size, downlink forwarding, for EHandoverType_InterEnb handover, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte; discard cause is user deletion), Amount of discarded forwarding data per bearer index 1..16 on transmitter side (PDCP SDU size, uplink forwarding, EHandoverType_InterEnb handover, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte; discard cause is user deletion), Amount of forwarded data per bearer index 1..16 on transmitter side (PDCP SDU size, downlink forwarding, Inter RAT forwarding, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte), Amount of forwarded data per bearer index 1..16 on receiver side (PDCP SDU size, downlink forwarding, Inter RAT forwarding, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte), Amount of discarded forwarding data per bearer index 1..16 on transmitter side (PDCP SDU size, downlink forwarding, for EHandoverType_InterRatToWcdma handover, for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte; discard cause is user deletion). Reporting period: 1000ms ... 3600000ms, step size 1000ms, valid for the indicated cell. Sampling period: n/a (ignored).
enum-member.name: EMeasurementGroupTypeTup_DataForwarding

enum-member.comment: Includes: Amount of data buffered PDCP (for the indicated cell, reporting unit is Byte). Usage (value range restriction) of reporting period and sampling period is the same as EMeasurementGroupTypeTup_DataForwarding.
enum-member.name: EMeasurementGroupTypeTup_PdcpTraffic

typedef.comment: Length of PDCP sequence number in bits
typedef.name: TPdcpSnLength

typedef.comment: Time interval between sending GTP-U Echo Requests
typedef.name: TPathSupervisInterval

typedef.comment: Maximum waiting time for GTP-U Echo Response message
typedef.name: TRespTime

typedef.comment:
context id for ROHC channel
context 0 is used for ROHC uncompressed profile
typedef.name: TRohcCID

constant.comment:
Relative index offsets for reported values, depending on Measurement Group Type - sequence of reported group values is the same as defined in TUP_MeasurementInitiationReq measurementGroupTypeList IE.
For EMeasurementGroupTypeTup_DataForwarding: 0) value of Dl Fwd Tx Inter eNB forwarding for index 1, ... 15) value of Dl Fwd Tx Inter eNB forwarding for index 16, 16) value of Dl Fwd Rx Inter eNB forwarding for index 1, ... 31) value of Dl Fwd Rx Inter eNB forwarding for index 16, 32) value of Ul Fwd Tx for index 1, ... 47) value of Ul Fwd Tx for index 16, 48) value of Ul Fwd Rx for index 1, ... 63) value of Ul Fwd Rx for index 16, 64) value of Dl Fwd Tx discard for EHandoverType_InterEnb for index 1, ... 79) value of Dl Fwd Tx discard for EHandoverType_InterEnb for index 16, 80) value of Ul Fwd Tx discard for EHandoverType_InterEnb for index 1, ... 95) value of Ul Fwd Tx discard for EHandoverType_InterEnb for index 16, 96) value of Dl Fwd Tx Inter RAT forwarding for index 1, ... 111) value of Dl Fwd Tx Inter RAT forwarding for index 16, 112) value of Dl Fwd Rx Inter RAT forwarding for index 1, ... 127) value of Dl Fwd Rx Inter RAT forwarding for index 16, 128) value of Dl Fwd Tx discard for EHandoverType_InterRatToWcdma for index 1, ... 143) value of Dl Fwd Tx discard for EHandoverType_InterRatToWcdma for index 16.
For EMeasurementGroupTypeTup_PdcpTraffic: 0) amount of buffered PDCP data
constant.name: MAX_NUM_MEAS_REPORT_VALUE_TUP

constant.comment: TUP_UserContextResp message has to be sent 8 times.
constant.name: MAX_NUM_UE_PER_MSG

constant.comment: Maximum number of parallel user deletions supported, used by LTE TUPu.
constant.name: MAX_NUM_OF_PARALLEL_USER_DELETIONS

member.comment: DCM feature. DCM range 1..16. For WMP can be set to 0. Value 0 means unused. The value classifies the bearer for measurement reporting. See specification of MAX_NUM_MEAS_REPORT_VALUE_TUP, description for EMeasurementGroupTypeTup_DataForwarding. Ignored in case of dataForwardingType is set to EDataForwarding_NoForwarding This IE serves also as a logical channel priority (LCP) for the RB.

member.comment: bearer identification

member.comment: Indicates which kind of data forwarding should be applied to this DRB. DL and UL forwarding can be switched on separately. DL data forwarding during Inter RAT handover is optionally supported only for DCM product (dependency from dataForwardingType IE setting). UL data forwarding is never supported during Inter RAT handover due to 3GPP.
member.name: dataForwardingType

member.comment: IEs for GTP-U protocol for downlink forwarding.

member.comment: IEs for GTP-U protocol for uplink forwarding.

member.name: index

member.comment: bearer identification
member.name: drbId

member.comment: Receive status of UL PDCP SDUs See TS 36.423, chapter 9.1.1.4 Bitstring with size of 4096 bit. 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.
member.name: rxStatusOfUlPdcpSdus

member.comment: The value is not evaluated in client for RLC-UM bearer (i.e. any value can be filled for RLC-UM).

member.comment: bearer identification
member.name: drbId

member.comment: unit is milliseconds, 0 - no delay, 2001 - timer disabled, value infinity set in DCM Timer for maximum S1 data retard in Inter FSM HO data forwarding. Start the timer upon reception of the first DL packet via S1 interface. Are S1 packets already received timer starts immediately. Timer can be stopped with user deletion, data forward deletion or receiving of GTP-U: END MARKER. After timer expiry forwarded X2 packets will be discarded.
member.name: tS1DataRetard

member.comment: Receive status of UL PDCP SDUs See TS 36.423, chapter 9.1.1.4 Bitstring with size of 4096 bit. 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.
member.name: rxStatusOfUlPdcpSdus

member.name: drbId

member.name: qciCounterGroup

member.comment: SIC address containing CCID and TRSW node ID. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr2 ignores this field.
member.name: trswSicad

member.comment: GCAD address containing EQID and CCID. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr2 and FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: trswGcad

member.comment: Transport Layer (IP) address of S-GW for EPS Bearer (GTPu) addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: sGwTransportLayerAddress

member.comment: eNB transport layer address associated with this EPS bearer. addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: enbTransportLayerAddress

member.comment: remote TEID
member.name: sGwTeid

member.comment: Local GTP Tunnel Endpoint ID for S1 connection (at LTE TUP). Value range WMP: 1..65535, Value range DCM: 1..4294967295
member.name: enbS1Teid

member.comment: Local GTP Tunnel Endpoint ID for X2 DL forwarding tunnel (at LTE TUP in case of target cell). Value range WMP: 1..65535, Value range DCM: 1..4294967295
member.name: enbX2DlTeid

member.comment: GTP Tunnel Endpoint ID for X2 UL forwarding tunnel Value range WMP: 1..65535, Value range DCM: 1..4294967295 UL data forwarding never supported during Inter RAT HO.
member.name: enbX2UlTeid

member.comment: DSCP value set to IP header TOS field. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: dscp

member.comment: unit is milliseconds, 0 -> no discard DCM: This parameter indicates the delay before a PDCP PDU along with the corresponding PDCP SDU is discarded from buffer. This timer shall be set in way that the packet delay defined by QCI characteristics is kept. This timer can be disabled by setting the parameter to "disabled". WMP: This parameter indicates the minimum delay between a timestamp of an oldest PDCP PDU in buffer after which oldest PDCP SDU is discarded with 0.01 probability. If the delay doesn’t exceed tDiscard, packet is discarded with probability lower than 0.01. This parameter shall be set in way that the packet delay defined by QCI characteristics is kept. This parameter can be disabled by setting it to "disabled".
member.name: tDiscard

member.comment:
Indicates PDCP PDU Header length for DRBs in bits.
In case of RLC UM the length value can be either 7 or 12 In case of RLC AM the length value has to be set to 12
member.name: pdcpSnLength

member.comment: Indicates whether status report is requested in case of handover. Status report can be requested for UL (eNB sends status report and DL (eNb receives status report) separately. EStatusReport_eNbStatusReport: requests eNB to send status report EStatusReport_UeStatusReport: indicates status report sent by UE EStatusReport_eNbUeStatusReport: requests eNB to send status report and indicates status report sent by UE
member.name: statusReportReq

member.comment: enable or disable ROHC. disabling means that subsequent parameters are not evaluated
member.name: rohcEnable

member.comment: List of supported profiles, if peer does not support as many profiles as MAX_NUM_OF_ROHC_PROFILES suggests, insert EPdcpRohcProfile_Undefined for the remaining entries in list. The profile 0x0000 'uncompressed' has to be delivered always if ROHC is enabled.
member.name: rohcProfileList

member.comment:
maximum ROHC context id for downlink
Note: sum of ROHC contexts of each bearer of a user MUST follow the range restrictions of TRohcCID
member.name: rohcMaxCidDl

member.comment:
maximum ROHC context id for uplink
Note: sum of ROHC contexts of each bearer of a user MUST follow the range restrictions of TRohcCID
member.name: rohcMaxCidUl

member.comment: unit is milliseconds, 0 -> no discard DCM: This parameter indicates the delay before a PDCP PDU along with the corresponding PDCP SDU is discarded from buffer. This timer shall be set in way that the packet delay defined by QCI characteristics is kept. This timer can be disabled by setting the parameter to "disabled". WMP: This parameter indicates the minimum delay between a timestamp of an oldest PDCP PDU in buffer after which oldest PDCP SDU is discarded with 0.01 probability. If the delay doesn’t exceed tDiscard, packet is discarded with probability lower than 0.01. This parameter shall be set in way that the packet delay defined by QCI characteristics is kept. This parameter can be disabled by setting it to "disabled".
member.name: tDiscard

member.comment:
Indicates PDCP PDU Header length for DRBs in bits.
In case of RLC UM the length value can be either 7 or 12 In case of RLC AM the length value has to be set to 12
member.name: pdcpSnLength

member.comment: enable or disable ROHC. disabling means that subsequent parameters are not evaluated
member.name: rohcEnable

member.comment: List of supported profiles, if peer does not support as many profiles as MAX_NUM_OF_ROHC_PROFILES suggests, insert EPdcpRohcProfile_Undefined for the remaining entries in list. The profile 0x0000 'uncompressed' has to be delivered always if ROHC is enabled.
member.name: rohcProfileList

member.comment:
maximum ROHC context id for downlink
Note: sum of ROHC contexts of each bearer of a user MUST follow the range restrictions of TRohcCID

member.comment: step 1, DCM/WMP default: 3, RoHC Full Header Counter, number of full headers to be transmitted in IR state.
member.name: rohcFullHdCount

member.comment: step 2, DCM/WMP default: 256, RoHC Header Refresh period, periodicity for transmitting of full header in IR state.
member.name: rohcHdRefreshPeriod

member.comment: step 1, RoHC K 1. Number of failed compressed headers in FC state for transferring to SC state in U-mode Decompression.
member.name: rohcK1

member.comment: step 1, RoHC N1. Number of decompressed headers window where rohcK1s are counted.
member.name: rohcN1

member.comment: step 1, RoHC K2. Number of failed updates in SC state for transferring to NC state in U-mode Decompression.
member.name: rohcK2

member.comment: step 1, RoHC N2. Number of updated headers window where rohcK2s are counted.
member.name: rohcN2

member.comment: True (Enable), RoHC Header compressor O-mode Enable.
member.name: rohcHdDecomOmodeEnable

member.comment: Overflow threshold margin of DL PDCP Buffer per cell. threshold = thOverflowDiscard * 0,5 + 1 [MB] Value range: 1...16MB, step 500kb. Not used value is 0xFFFFFFFF which disables the cell based discarding function. WMP shall use always value 0xFFFFFFFF.
member.name: thOverflowDiscard

member.comment:
Per-cell based Overflow Discard function and CPU overload discard function activation bitmap per Logical Channel Index. Used also for UE based discarding in HDBDE. Value: 0: not applied nonzero: overflow discard applied on the LoCH Index
Bit #1 (LSB) - LoCH Index #1 Bit #2 - LoCH Index #2 ... Bit #16 - LoCH Index #16
member.name: flagOverflowDiscard

member.comment: DCM specific parameter that indicates whether there is need to calculate PDCP data buffer level. WMP shall set this to FALSE.
member.name: discBuffThrAct

member.comment: DCM specific PDCP buffer high threshold. WMP uses 0. Unit: kbytes (= 1000 bytes)
member.name: discBuffHighThr

member.comment:
DCM specific PDCP buffer high threshold per UE category, used in HDBDE: [0]: For UE category 1 [1]: For UE category 2 [2]: For UE category 3 … [7]: For UE category 8
WMP doesn't use it. Unit of elements of the array: kbytes (= 1000 bytes), range: 0..19200.
member.name: discBuffHighThrList

member.comment: Channel bandwidth of the Cell.
member.name: chBw

member.comment: Cell identification
member.name: lnCelId

member.comment: Primary PLMN Id of the cell. Used for counters. Not used in DCM eNB but DCM shall set all 0 in the IEG (0 for all 3 IEs in the IEG).
member.name: primaryPLMNId

member.comment: List of cell PLMN ids. WMP only, 'numOfPlmnIdList' set to 0 in DCM.
member.name: plmnIdList

member.comment: O&M parameters for Robust Header Compression/Decompression.
member.name: rohcCellParameters

member.name: lnCelId

member.comment: Used by Client to uniquely identify the user. Also TUP uses the field to address user contexts.
member.name: ueId

member.comment: Taken from the corresponding request message.
member.name: transactionId

member.comment: Message Unit Identifier. Used as a transaction ID in L3signalling if respFlag == 0 and harqRespFlag == 0 then mui = 0 valid range for mui 1..4294967295
member.name: mui

member.comment:
Copy of the RRC message which was requested to be sent in the corresponding TUP_SrbSendReq message.
Parameter will only be set in failure cause (EStatusLte_NotOk). Otherwise the length of this array is 0.
member.name: l3Payload

member.comment: Cell identification
member.name: lnCelId

member.comment: Used by Client to uniquely identify the user. Also TUP uses the field to address user contexts.
member.name: ueId

member.comment: The value of this field will be stored and set into the corresponding response message.
member.name: transactionId

member.comment: PLMN Id of the UE chosen during RRC Connection Setup. Used for counters. Not used in DCM eNB but DCM shall set all 0 in the IEG (0 for all 3 IEs in the IEG). This IE holds valid PLMN Id only if "handoverType" is different than EHandoverType_NoHandover (0).
member.name: plmnId

member.comment: to be used for TUP_ErrorInd
member.name: tupUserAddress

member.comment: to be used for TUP_SrbReceiveInd
member.name: tupSgnlSrbAddress

member.comment: Mac Data interface address for this user. The address shall be the same for all users in a cell in FSMr2. Not used and set 0xFFFFFFFF in HDBDE and FSMr3 with LTE L2 onwards.
member.name: macUserAddr

member.comment: Indicates the reason for the TUP_UserSetupReq message
member.name: handoverType

member.comment: Identifies the source user context. Evaluated only if handoverType is 1=IntraFspx, 5=IntraCell, 8=IntraCellReestablishment, 9=IntraFspxReestablishment, 11=IntraEnbSourceIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 12=IntraEnbSourceIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 14=InterEnbX2SourceIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 15=InterEnbX2SourceIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 17=InterRatToWcdmaIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 18=InterRatToWcdmaIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 20=IntraEnbTargetIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 21=IntraEnbTargetIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 23=InterEnbX2TargetIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 24=InterEnbX2TargetIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 26=InterRatToLteIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 27=InterRatToLteIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO.
member.name: sourceUeId

member.comment: DCM only. WMP shall set to FALSE. If True UL transmission will be suspended for the whole UE until TUP_ResumeUlTxReq is received. Evaluated only if handoverType is 4=InterEnb, 6=InterRatToLte, 23=InterEnbX2TargetIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 24=InterEnbX2TargetIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 25=InterEnbX2TargetInterFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 26=InterRatToLteIntraCellReestablishmentWithHO, 27=InterRatToLteIntraFspxReestablishmentWithHO, 28=InterRatToLteInterFspxReestablishmentWithHO, Flag is ignored in other HO cases.
member.name: suspendUlTx

member.comment: Defined UE radio capability. UE having category of 1 supports only one layer transmission.

member.name: handoverType

member.comment: DCM only. Set to FALSE in WMP. Identifies the DL forwarding type in case of Inter RAT to WCDMA handover (EHandoverType = 7). Shall be ignored in other cases. FALSE = Normal DL forwarding starts with PDCP PDUs which are not acknowledged by MAC. TRUE = DL forwarding starts with first PDCP PDU (RLC SDU) which has not been sent to UE. Corresponding packetId will be delivered by MAC.
member.name: dcmDlInterRatFoType

member.comment: Node Id of TUPu Uplink Master. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: ulMasterNid

member.comment: Node Id of TUPu Downlink Master. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: dlMasterNid

member.comment: Node Id of TUPu Downlink Slave. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: dlSlaveNid

member.comment: Node Id of deployable unit "LTE MAC DL UE" of MAC system component. Used for MAC_MacDataBuffer procedure.
member.name: macDataServiceNid

member.comment: The identity of the eNB. Required for counter registration. WMP only.
member.name: enbId

member.comment: Result consists of status, cause and specific cause.
member.name: messageResult

member.comment: Taken from the corresponding request message.
member.name: transactionId

member.comment: IP address of S-GW. addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address.
member.name: remoteTransportLayerAddress

member.comment: External IP address of own eNB addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address.
member.name: uPlaneIpAddress

member.comment: status of data path
member.name: status

member.comment: The value of this field will be stored and set into the corresponding response message.
member.name: transactionId

member.comment: The value for GTP-U management procedure messages. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: dscp

member.comment: Limit of unacknowledged PDCP PDUs sent from LTE TUP(u) to LTE MAC. Values: TRUE - LTE TUP(u) limits the number of unacknowledged PDCP PDUs sent to LTE MAC to maximum of 2047; FALSE - LTE TUP(u) always sends all PDCP PDUs to LTE MAC (no limit).
member.name: pdcpTxSnLimit

member.comment: List of eNB IP address info elements addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: uPlaneIpAddress

member.comment: Result consists of status, cause and specific cause.
member.name: messageResult

member.comment: Taken from the corresponding request message.
member.name: transactionId

member.comment: Number of valid addresses in tupGtpuReceiveAddress and tupGtpuReceiveEqId arrays. Each index in these arrays corresponds to one ueGroup id. FSMr3 and HD-BDE only. In FSMr2 LTE TUPu shall set it to 1.
member.name: numOfUeGroups

member.comment: LTE TUP(u) addresses per UE Group for reception of DL GTP-U messages. First numOfUeGroups of addresses in array are valid. FSMr3 only. In FSMr2 and HD-BDE LTE TUPu shall set first SIC address in the list to 0 (invalid value).
member.name: tupGtpuReceiveAddress

member.comment: LTE TUP(u) Event Queue Id per UE Group for reception of DL GTP-U messages. First numOfUeGroups of Event Queue Ids in array are valid. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr2 and FSMr3 ignores this field.
member.name: tupGtpuReceiveEqId

member.comment: Address of the service where ENBC wants to receive the DataPathStatus-Indication messages(returned by ENBC in the NetworkConfigResponse)
member.name: enbcDatapathStatusAddress

member.comment: SIC address of TrswConfig interface. LTE TUP(u) in FSMr2 ignores this field.
member.name: trswConfigSicad

member.comment: If set to true then for every path a TUP_DataPathStatusInd message is sent. This is done as soon as the status is known by either reception of a valid GTP-U Echo Response for that path or by end of supervision cycle.
member.name: initialStatusReportRequested

member.comment: External IP address of own eNB addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address.
member.name: uPlaneIpAddress

member.comment: Time interval between sending GTP-U Echo Requests. Unit is seconds. Range DCM: 0...65535 Range WMP: 0...300 0 means path supervision is "switched off".
member.name: gtpuPathSupint

member.comment: Maximum waiting time for GTP-U Echo Response messages. Unit is seconds. Range DCM: 1...65535 Range WMP: 1...60
member.name: gtpuT3Resp

member.comment: Number of unanswered echo requests (within time defined by gtpuT3Resp), used for declaring GTP-U path failure Range DCM: 1...65535 Range WMP: 1...15
member.name: gtpuN3Reqs

member.comment: Transport Network Node id. Used in reporting BTS faults. Used only in FSMr3. Used only by WMP, in DCM case FAM shall set this IE to 0.
member.name: transportNwId

member.comment: Transport Layer (IP) addresses of S-GW for which data path supervision has to be started addressLength field to distinguish between IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4: Encoding of address field is IP w.x.y.z. byte 0: w byte 1: x byte 2: y byte 3: z. IPv6: 128-bit IPv6 address.
member.name: sgwIpAddress

member.comment: Result consists of status, cause and specific cause.
member.name: messageResult

member.comment: Only the following carrier bandwidth values can be indicated: ECarrierBandwidth_5MHz = 25 ECarrierBandwidth_10MHz = 50 ECarrierBandwidth_15MHz = 75 ECarrierBandwidth_20MHz = 100 ECarrierBandwidth_05_05MHz = 2525 ECarrierBandwidth_05_10MHz = 2550 ECarrierBandwidth_10_05MHz = 5025 ECarrierBandwidth_10_10MHz = 5050
